reqs:
Pre-reqs: One of COMM 293, COMM 457 and either (a) all of ECON 101, ECON 102 or (b) all of ECON 310, ECON 311 or (c) ECON 100 or (d) all of ECON 101, ECON 311 or (e) all of ECON 102, ECON 310.
Co-reqs: All of COMM 329, COMM 465, COMM 473.
Non-Commerce students only. It cannot be counted for credit in the BCom program. If you are unable to register in a section of this course and you have been admitted by your Faculty to the Minor in Commerce or another approved program in which this course is a requirement, you may submit a registration request using the form available on the Sauder website: https://mybcom.sauder.ubc.ca/courses-money-enrolment/courses-and-registration/registration-assistance .
Students not meeting any of the criteria within the restricted seats remaining will only be able to register if there are general seats available.
NOTE: Course registration is administered by the Sauder Undergraduate Office and NOT the instructor (DO NOT CONTACT THE INSTRUCTOR).

description: A conceptual and practical introduction to the major areas of business strategy with an integrative perspective on managing a business. Includes the analysis of a business and its environment, the development and evaluation of strategic alternatives, and implementation of change (For non-Commerce students only in fourth year).
